channel.title: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
channel.description: Polls aren't working right now so just reply, I guess. How long do you spend on a track?

item.title: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
item.dc:creator: BALLISTIK
item.description:
Anywhere from 1 hour to 3 or 4, for my first session. During that time I create the drop. Usually I come back later and tweak things, and arrange scenes, and sometimes if I have a REALLY good idea and/or am not satisfied but reluctant to throw the track away altogether, I will completely overhaul the project. Other times (this happens a lot,) I will get rough idea down, then come back (sometimes months) later and make a track out of it.

Read full topic
item.source: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?

item.title: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
item.dc:creator: anon6476606
item.description:
I’m just gonna say the usual answer: it depends. Some of my most popular / best tracks have been made in a day, and some have taken weeks. However, I usually spend tons of time doing nothing and playing with chord progressions that I end up not liking – and then I make a good song in a much shorter amount of time once I find something I like.

Read full topic
item.source: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?

item.title: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
A good way to save time is to keep the length down. Lots of Auxy songs over three minutes tend to drag a bit unless something new happens.

item.title: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
item.dc:creator: moemx
item.description:
So there’s lots of kept ideas… and I almost always need about 4 hours from idea to - let’s say - 85% version.

I then sleep on it.

And continue for a couple of small sessions a day later to normally finish in another 1-2 hours…

I asked a while ago how long it takes people on average for BTC’s which may be a related question… @DH0

How long do you spend on a Beat The Clock challenge? Contest & Challenges
Wondering about process and duration of sessions of you guys. For me judging by the last two challenges it took about 3-4 hours per track. Maybe split Into 2-3 sessions and some small adjustments here and there afterwards. But I believe the more often that happens (pressure-wise), the better and more efficient sessions get. How about you? Let’s find out (in average hours per challenge) poll

Read full topic
item.source: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?

item.source: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?

item.title: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
The process I’ve discovered that works for me is to press record and just jam.
I commit all midi parts to audio as early as possible as it forces me to move forward with a track.

I’ll make rudimentary edits as I go and if I don’t have something I like after a few hours I simply delete it.

I usually come back the next day and spend a few hours on arrangement and a rough mixdown.

I’ll listen to the track over next week or two and if I still like it I’ll spend another few hours on a final mix and master.

Read full topic
item.source: How Long Do You Spend On a Track?
